metadata.Title: CVE-2021-41617 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
sshd in OpenSSH 6.2 through 8.x before 8.8, when certain non-defaultconfigurations are used, allows privilege escalation because supplementalgroups are not initialized as expected. Helper programs forAuthorizedKeysCommand and AuthorizedPrincipalsCommand may run withprivileges associated with group memberships of the sshd process, if theconfiguration specifies running the command as a different user.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu7
openssh-server - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu7
openssh-sftp-server - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu7
openssh-tests - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu7
ssh - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu7
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:9.0p1-1ubuntu7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.0p1-1ubuntu7').
openssh-ssh1 package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
